project_description: A simple Flutter application demonstrating the Cubit pattern for state management. The app has a single screen that displays a text with an icon, and toggles between 'Cat' with a clock icon and 'Dog' with a person icon when tapped.
architecture_overview: The project follows a modular architecture with separation of concerns. The state management is handled using the Cubit pattern, and the UI components are organized by screens and widgets.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen : Click Text
HomeScreen -> TextCubit : toggleText()
TextCubit -> TextModel : Update state
TextModel -> HomeScreen : New state
HomeScreen -> TextDisplay : Update UI
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the Cubit pattern. The TextCubit manages the state of the text and icon. When the user taps the text, the toggleText method in TextCubit is called, which updates the state. The HomeScreen widget listens to state changes and rebuilds the TextDisplay widget with the new state.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen (HomeScreen) and does not include any navigation to other screens.
